intro: Synotis baoshanensis, commonly known as the Baoshan synotis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
